Key Match Events: India won the 2nd T20I against Bangladesh by 86 runs, taking an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series.
Bangladesh was restricted to 135/9 while chasing 222 runs.
All seven Indian bowlers picked up wickets.
Nitish Kumar Reddy took two key wickets, including Mahmudullah and Tanzim Hasan Sakib.
Hardik Pandya took a splendid catch to dismiss Rishad Hossain.
Riyan Parag took the wicket of Mehidy Hasan Miraz.
Pre-Game Insights: India aimed to win the match to secure an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series.
Bangladesh captain Najmul Hossain Shanto criticized his team for their performance in the first T20I and emphasized the need for improvement.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi.
Arshdeep Singh was named Man of the Match for his figures of 3/14 in the first T20I.
